title: Big Tech Antitrust Is Where Republicans and Democrats Can Agree, DOJ Official Says
text:
The Justice Department’s chief antitrust official asserted on Tuesday that there is growing bipartisan discussion on how to address competition in the technology sector.

Makan Delrahim, the assistant attorney general for the Justice Department’s antitrust division made the comment at The Wall Street Journal’s technology conference in Laguna Beach, Calif. Large tech companies have been coming under attack from both sides of the political aisle over alleged unfair competitive behavior. While Delrahim did not promise to prosecute...
description: Makan Delrahim, the Justice Department’s antitrust chief, tells a Wall Street Journal conference that Big Tech and competition is an area where Democrats and Republicans can agree.
